Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the deaths of eight mostly vaccinated people in Santa Barbara County during the 2017-2018 flu season, suggesting that it proves that one should not get the flu shot.
Understate: The claim understates the effectiveness of the flu vaccine, stating that it is only 10 percent effective, while the expert mentions that it has been effective at knocking out the H3N2 strain 32 percent of the time.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough support for the assertion that the deaths of the eight individuals were directly caused by the flu shot.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to establish a causal link between the deaths and the flu shot.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the deaths of the eight individuals are solely attributable to the flu shot without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the deaths, such as underlying health conditions or other factors that may have contributed to their susceptibility to the flu.
